channel.title: Cant attack someone with same cape
channel.description:
I know this is a very simple code and i am sorry for asking i just forgot how to do it...
How do you make it so that if someone in certain coords have the same cape as you can not be attacked by you...

item.title: Cant attack someone with same cape
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

umm… lets see…

complete pseudo code:

[code]Player other; //its initailized…

//checks to see if players are in area…
if(this.cordx >= 2004 && this.cordx <= 2323 && this.cordy >= 2002 && this.cordy <=2032 && other.cordx … ect…
&& this.GetCape() == other.GetCape() && this.GetCape() != -1)

[/code]

add a GetCape() method (probably getCape() because of java coding standards), that returns the Id of the cape they are wearing -1 if they are not wearign one

lol, very very simple thing…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 01, 2009, 01:24:36 pm[/size][hr]I honestly would create an object like Area and Cord, like so:


class Area
{

public Area (Cord firstPoint, Cord secondPoint)
{
this.firstPoint = firstPoint;
this.secondPoint = secondPoint;
}

public boolean contains(Player p)
{
   if (p.getCord().getX() >= firstPoint.getX() && p.getCord().getX() <= secondPoint.getX() ... ect...)
       return true;
   return false;
}

private Cord firstPoint;
private Cord secondPoint;
}

class Cord
{
public Cord (int x, int y)
{
this.x = x;
this.y = y;
}
public int getX()
{
return x;
}
public int getY()
{
return y;
}
private int x;
private int y;
}

Read full topic
